page.title: 01Assington, Hagmore Green
page.content: Assington's population is 382 (1981 Census), spread over 145 houses and bungalows, including Grade 1 and 11 listed buildings which were part of Gurdon Estate, sold in 1938. Assington Hall, formerly seat of the historic Gurdon family (once visited by Oliver Cromwell) was burnt down in 1957; only the ruins remain. Apart from Assington Thicks (127 acres) and other smaller areas of woodland, the surrounding fields of both Assington and Hagmore Green are mainly given over to agriculture. The residential part of the village consists of the street, Barracks road, Dyers Lane and Further Street (along the A134). Working Farms include Park Farm, East Farm, Hill Farm, Mill Farm, Hicks Farm, Assington House, Severals Farm, Home Farm, and Willow Tree Farm (now an orchard).
